intro: Aegilops tripsacoides, commonly known as wild wheat, is a wild relative of modern wheat species. It is native to the Americas and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. This plant has small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. It is known for its genetic diversity, which makes it valuable for breeding programs aimed at improving wheat resilience. Aegilops tripsacoides plays an important role in the study of cereal evolution and crop improvement.
